pony_gp module¶

pony_gp.append_node(node, symbol)¶

Return the appended node. Append a symbol to the node.

Parameters:
  • node (list) – The node that will be appended to
  • symbol (str) – The symbol that is appended
Returns:

The new node
Return type:

list
pony_gp.evaluate(node, case)¶

Evaluate a node recursively. The node’s symbol string is evaluated.

Parameters:
  • node (list) – Evaluated node
  • case (list) – Current fitness case
Returns:

Value of the evaluation
Return type:

float
pony_gp.evaluate_fitness(individuals, param)¶

Perform the fitness evaluation for each individual of the population.

Parameters:
  • individuals (list) – Population to evaluate
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
pony_gp.evaluate_individual(individual, fitness_cases, targets, symbols=None)¶

Evaluate fitness based on fitness cases and target values. Fitness cases are a set of exemplars (input and output points) by comparing the error between the output of an individual(symbolic expression) and the target values.

Evaluates and sets the fitness in an individual. Fitness is the negative mean square error(MSE).

Parameters:
  • param –
  • individual (dict) – Individual solution to evaluate
  • fitness_cases (list) – Input for the evaluation
  • targets (list) – Output corresponding to the input
pony_gp.evaluate_nodes(root, case, functions)¶

Return the float value from the evaluation of the nodes. Non-recursive evaluation of the nodes. Depth first left-to-right traversal

This function can be called from evaluate_individual instead of evaluate.

Parameters:
  • root (list) – Root of tree to evaluate
  • case (list) – Current fitness case
  • functions (list) – Function symbols (operators)
Returns:

Value of the evaluation
Return type:

float
pony_gp.find_and_replace_subtree(root, subtree, node_idx, idx)¶

Returns the current index and replaces the root with another subtree at the given index. The index is based on depth-first left-to-right traversal.

Parameters:
  • root (list) – Root of the tree
  • subtree (list) – Subtree that will replace the root
  • node_idx (int) – Index of the node to be replaced
  • idx (int) – Current index
Returns:

Current index
Return type:

int
pony_gp.generational_replacement(new_population, old_population, param)¶

Return new a population. The elite_size best old_population are appended to the new population. They are kept in the new population if they are better than the worst.

Parameters:
  • new_population (list) – the new population
  • old_population (list) – the old population
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:

the new population with the best from the old population
Return type:

list
pony_gp.get_children(node)¶

Return the children of the node. The children are all the elements of the except the first :param node: The node :type node: list :return: The children of the node :rtype: list

pony_gp.get_depth_from_index(node, idx, node_idx, depth, idx_depth)¶

Return the depth of a node based on the index. The index is based on depth-first left-to-right traversal.

Parameters:
  • node (list) – Current node
  • idx (int) – Current index
  • node_idx (int) – Index of the node which depth we are searching for
  • depth (int) – Current depth
  • idx_depth (int) – Depth of the node at the given index
Returns:

Current index and depth of the node at the given index
Return type:

tuple
pony_gp.get_max_tree_depth(node, depth, max_depth)¶

Return the max depth of the tree. Recursively traverse the tree

Parameters:
  • node (list) – Root of the tree
  • depth (int) – Current tree depth
  • max_depth (int) – Maximum depth of the tree
Returns:

Maximum depth of the tree
Return type:

int
pony_gp.get_node_at_index(root, idx)¶

Return the node in the tree at a given index. The index is according to a depth-first left-to-right ordering.

Parameters:
  • root (list) – Root of tree
  • idx (int) – Index of node to find
Returns:

Node at the given index (based on depth-first left-to-right indexing)
Return type:

list
pony_gp.get_number_of_nodes(root, cnt)¶

Return the number of nodes in the tree. A recursive depth-first left-to-right search is done

Parameters:
  • root (list) – Root of tree
  • cnt (int) – Current number of nodes in the tree
Returns:

Number of nodes in the tree
Return type:

int
pony_gp.get_random_symbol(depth, max_depth, symbols, full=False)¶

Return a randomly chosen symbol. The depth determines if a terminal must be chosen. If full is specified a function will be chosen until the max depth. The symbols is picked with a uniform probability.

Parameters:
  • depth (int) – Current depth
  • max_depth (int) – Max depth determines if a function symbol can be chosen. I.e. a symbol with arity greater than zero
  • symbols (dict) – The possible symbols.
  • full – True if function symbols should be drawn until max depth
Returns:

A random symbol
Return type:

str
pony_gp.get_symbols()¶
Return a symbol dictionary. Helper method to keep the code clean. The nodes in a GP tree consists of different symbols. The symbols are either functions (internal nodes with arity > 0) or terminals (leaf nodes with arity = 0) The symbols is represented as a dictionary with the keys:

  • arities – A dictionary where a key is a symbol and the value is the arity

  • terminals – A list of strings(symbols) with arity 0

  • functions – A list of strings(symbols) with arity > 0

    return:Symbols used for GP individuals
    rtype:dict
pony_gp.get_test_and_train_data(fitness_cases_file, test_train_split)¶

Return test and train data.

Parameters:
  • fitness_cases_file (str) – CSV file with a header.
  • test_train_split (float) – Percentage of exemplar data used for training
Returns:

Test and train data. Both cases and targets
Return type:

tuple
pony_gp.grow(node, depth, max_depth, full, symbols)¶

Recursively grow a node to max depth in a pre-order, i.e. depth-first left-to-right traversal.

Parameters:
  • node (list) – Root node of subtree
  • depth (int) – Current tree depth
  • max_depth (int) – Maximum tree depth
  • full (bool) – grows the tree to max depth when true
  • symbols (dict) – set of symbols to chose from
pony_gp.initialize_population(param)¶

Ramped half-half initialization. The individuals in the population are initialized using the grow or the full method for each depth value (ramped) up to max_depth.

Parameters:param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:List of individuals
Return type:list
pony_gp.main()¶

Search. Evaluate best solution on out-of-sample data

pony_gp.out_of_sample_test(individual, fitness_cases, targets, symbols)¶

Out-of-sample test on an individual solution

Parameters:
  • individual (dict) – Solution to test on data
  • fitness_cases (list) – Input data used for testing
  • targets (list) – Target values of data
pony_gp.parse_arguments()¶

Returns a dictionary of the default parameters, or the ones set by commandline arguments

Returns:parameters for the GP run
Return type:dict
pony_gp.parse_exemplars(file_name)¶

Parse a CSV file. Parse the fitness case and split the data into Test and train data. In the fitness case file each row is an exemplar and each dimension is in a column. The last column is the target value of the exemplar.

Parameters:file_name (str) – CSV file with header
Returns:Fitness cases and targets
Return type:list
pony_gp.print_stats(generation, individuals)¶

Print the statistics for the generation and population.

:param generation:generation number :type generation: int :param individuals: population to get statistics for :type individuals: list

pony_gp.replace_subtree(new_subtree, old_subtree)¶

Replace a subtree.

Parameters:
  • new_subtree (list) – The new subtree
  • old_subtree (list) – The old subtree
pony_gp.run(param)¶
Return the best solution. Create an initial population. Perform an evolutionary search.
Parameters:param – parameters for pony gp :type param: dict :returns: Best solution :rtype: dict
pony_gp.search_loop(population, param)¶

Return the best individual from the evolutionary search loop. Starting from the initial population.

Parameters:
  • population (list) – Initial population of individuals
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:

Best individual
Return type:

Individual
pony_gp.sort_population(individuals)¶

Return a list sorted on the fitness value of the individuals in the population. Descending order.

Parameters:individuals (list) – The population of individuals
Returns:THe population of individuals sorted by fitness in descending order
Return type:list
pony_gp.subtree_crossover(parent1, parent2, param)¶

Returns two individuals. The individuals are created by selecting two random nodes from the parents and swapping the subtrees.

# TODO control the depth of the child nodes

Parameters:
  • parent1 (dict) – Parent one to crossover
  • parent2 (dict) – Parent two to crossover
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:

Children from the crossed over parents
Return type:

tuple
pony_gp.subtree_mutation(individual, param)¶

Return a new individual by randomly picking a node and growing a new subtree from it.

Parameters:
  • individual (dict) – Individual to mutate
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:

Mutated individual
Return type:

list
pony_gp.tournament_selection(population, param)¶

Return individuals from a population by drawing tournament_size competitors randomly and selecting the best of the competitors. population_size number of tournaments are held.

Parameters:
  • population (list) – Population to select from
  • param (dict) – parameters for pony gp
Returns:

selected individuals
Return type:

list
